Getting a Handle on “Undefined”

Rephrasing the question, the term “undefined” can conjure up a range of emotions for different people, depending on their past experiences and interpretations. Generally, though, it is a term that corresponds to something being unknown, up in the air, undetermined, able to go either way, needing more clarity, or in a state of flux. In other words, it’s not something that is set in stone, clear as day, decided, or finite.

So how do we live with “undefined”? When it comes up in life, how can we approach it successfully without feeling overwhelmed or discouraged?

Embrace the Unpredictability

The first step to managing life with “undefined” is to realise that some elements of life are just outside of our control. Accepting this fact can help soften the tension associated with unpredictability and put us in a more relaxed, confident state of mind.

This includes being able to take risks, trying something new and taking calculated leaps of faith. Instead of fearing the unknown, we can treat it as an opportunity for adventure and growth.

Don’t Sweat the Small Stuff

When uncontrollable circumstances arise and something is “undefined,” it can feel like the entire world is closing in on us. But it’s important to remember that the majority of life will simply carry on as usual – despite any undefined elements.

Don’t let whatever is undefined take over the entire narrative. Consider reframing the situation, and focus on the outcome you’d like to see. After all, there’s no point in dwelling on minor details that may or may not even affect you in the long run.

Have Faith

If all else fails – if nothing works, and life continues to feel undefined and out of your control, then it might help to access some form of faith. Life can be unpredictable and unpredictable things can happen, but faith can be a welcome comfort.

Tap into spiritual resources if that helps, or connect with a person, a pet, a plant – anything that provides you a sense of stability. Remember that you are always here and now and that there is something greater than you in all of this.

Take Precautions

Sometimes, it pays to be prepared. Even when elements are undefined and life is in flux, certain safety nets are in place that can help you, should any unexpected tragedy occur.

Take advantage of these precautions and tools without worrying, such as setting up a home or auto insurance policy, making an emergency fund, or even just having an open conversation with your loved ones about the importance of planning and preparation.

To sum it up, there is no one-size-fits-all solution to living with “undefined” - but that’s ok. The more mindful we are of life’s variables, the more confident we can be in navigating unknowns that come our way. That’s one thing that is certainly not undefined.
